intro: Heterophyllaea, commonly known as the variable-leaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is characterized by its morphological variation in leaf shape and size depending on environmental conditions. The leaves are typically alternate, simple, and may range from elliptic to ovate in form. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters. It is native to Australia and thrives in a variety of habitats, including forests and heathlands.
